(Simplified: 带)
Ideographic: A belt, creasing one's robe above 卌 but not below 巾
purpleculture_examples:
帶領 [ dài lǐng ]: to guide; to lead
帶動 [ dài dòng ]: to spur; to provide impetus; to drive
帶有 [ dài yǒu ]: to have; to involve
帶頭 [ dài tóu ]: to take the lead; to be the first; to set an example

heisig_chinese_memo: A twenty year old stripper spread her walking legs in many creative ways and receives a big sash (ribbon) which, crown, and expensive bath towel after winning the strip show contest.
Ru_trainchinese:
dài: (глаг) брать, носить с собой
dài: (глаг) делать вместе с другим действием; носить; иметь; вести за собой; воспитывать (ребенка)
dài: (сущ) ремень, пояс, лента; шина; зона
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The top part looks like mountain except with the horizontal stroke going through the middle instead of the bottom of the three vertical strokes.  The bottom half is a crown and a towel.  Arachaeologist digging under the mountain in an ancient royal tomb discover what looks like a towel, but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal sash for the kings's kimono.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Band " and " Hit " are similar in shape. The difference is that the middle of the " Band " is woven alternately from the " unitary " elephant silk thread, and the middle of the " Hit " is like a pattern with two selves facing each other or facing each other.

Oracle is used as a person's name. Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of the bells: "clothes, chang (shang), belt, market", which means upper garment, lower garment, belt, knee-covering (clothes covered on clothes during ancient pilgrimages and sacrifices). It is also used as a personal name to Ping Zhou Ge: "Working Ghost Salary". "Ghost pay" is a kind of punishment, extended to imprisonment, which means that the craftsman who made the war is named Dai, who is serving the ghost pay penalty. See also " pay ".

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period add "糸" as a symbol to indicate wearing, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 51: "The king of Wu is now as a leather chariot Qiancheng, 馄 (band) Jiawan, and on the day of Wuwu, he was involved in Mengjin." "馄 (band) Jiawan" means a soldier wearing armor. Million people.

There are three types of belts in ancient times. The second is a large belt, which is cut from plain, drilled, brocade, silk, etc., for corsets. The third is ribbon, which is woven (Zhu Dexi, Qiu Xigui).

"Said Wen": "Belt, gentry. Men's bandage, women's bandage, like a tie, and there must be a scarf."
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of a golden inscription like a garment belt, the upper and lower ends are like silk threads with the edges, and the middle is " unitary " (silk threads), like a ribbon interwoven. The original meaning is belt, and the extension is to wear and wear.
humanum_full_description:
「帶」和「黹」形近，其區別是「帶」中間從「幺」象絲線交互編織，「黹」中間象兩己相背或相向的花紋。

　　甲骨文用作人名。金文用作本義，子犯編鐘：「衣、常(裳)、帶、巿」，表示上衣、下裳、腰帶、蔽膝(古代朝覲、祭祀時蓋於衣裳上的服飾)。又用作人名，平周戈：「工鬼薪帶」。「鬼薪」是一種刑罰，引申為刑徒，表示造戈的工匠名叫帶，是服鬼薪刑的人，參見「薪」。

　　戰國竹簡加「糸」為意符，表示佩戴，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡51：「武王於是乎作為革車千乘、𦄂(帶)甲萬人，戊午之日，涉於孟津。」「𦄂(帶)甲萬人」表示佩帶盔甲的士兵一萬人。

　　古代帶有三類，一是革帶，以皮革制成，用以繫韠佩。二是大帶，以素、練、錦、縞等物剪裁而成，用以束衣。三是緄帶，編織而成(朱德熙、裘錫圭)。

　　《說文》：「帶，紳也。男子鞶帶，婦人帶絲，象繫佩之形，佩必有巾。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象衣帶之形，上下兩端象帶邊的絲緒，中間是「幺」(絲線)，象絲帶交織之形。本義是腰帶，引申為佩帶、佩戴。

①用皮、布或線等做成的長條物：帶子。皮帶。領帶。一衣帶水。
②像帶子的長條物：帶鋼。帶魚。聲帶。
③車輪胎：車帶。外帶。
④區域：地帶。溫帶。
⑤佩戴，披掛：帶孝。帶劍。
⑥隨身拿着：攜帶。帶挈。帶着錢。
⑦捎，連着，順便做：連帶。帶職。帶累(l噄)(連累)。話中帶刺。
⑧含有，呈現：帶電。帶傷。
⑨率領，引導：帶領。帶頭。帶動。以點帶面。
⑩女子陰道流出的白色的黏液：白帶。

「 帶 」和「 黹 」形近，其區別是「 帶 」中間從「 幺 」象絲線交互編織，「 黹 」中間象兩己相背或相向的花紋。 甲骨文用作人名。金文用作本義，子犯編鐘：「衣、常(裳)、帶、巿」，表示上衣、下裳、腰帶、蔽膝(古代朝覲、祭祀時蓋於衣裳上的服飾)。又用作人名，平周戈：「工鬼薪帶」。「鬼薪」是一種刑罰，引申為刑徒，表示造戈的工匠名叫帶，是服鬼薪刑的人，參見「 薪 」。 戰國竹簡加「 糸 」為意符，表示佩戴，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡51：「武王於是乎作為革車千乘、𦄂(帶)甲萬人，戊午之日，涉於孟津。」「𦄂(帶)甲萬人」表示佩帶盔甲的士兵一萬人。 古代帶有三類，一是革帶，以皮革制成，用以繫韠佩。二是大帶，以素、練、錦、縞等物剪裁而成，用以束衣。三是緄帶，編織而成(朱德熙、裘錫圭)。 《說文》：「帶，紳也。男子鞶帶，婦人帶絲，象繫佩之形，佩必有巾。」
" Band" and " Hit" are similar in shape. The difference is that the middle of the " Band" is woven alternately from the " unitary" elephant silk thread, and the middle of the " Hit" is like a pattern with two selves facing each other or facing each other. Oracle is used as a person's name. Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of the bells: "clothes, chang (shang), belt, market", which means upper garment, lower garment, belt, knee-covering (clothes covered on clothes during ancient pilgrimages and sacrifices). It is also used as a personal name to Ping Zhou Ge: "Working Ghost Salary". "Ghost pay" is a kind of punishment, extended to imprisonment, which means that the craftsman who made the war is named Dai, who is serving the ghost pay penalty. See also " pay". The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period add " 糸" as a symbol to indicate wearing, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 51: "The king of Wu is now as a leather chariot Qiancheng, 馄 (band) Jiawan, and on the day of Wuwu, he was involved in Mengjin." "馄 (band) Jiawan" means a soldier wearing armor. Million people. There are three types of belts in ancient times. The second is a large belt, which is cut from plain, drilled, brocade, silk, etc., for corsets. The third is ribbon, which is woven (Zhu Dexi, Qiu Xigui). "Said Wen": "Belt, gentry. Men's bandage, women's bandage, like a tie, and there must be a scarf."

帶字的基本解释

帶
dài
见“带”。

帶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dài］
［《廣韻》當蓋切，去泰，端。］
亦作“帯1”。“带1”的繁体字。
(1)用以约束衣服的狭长而扁平形状的物品。古代多用皮革、金玉、犀角或丝织物制成。
(2)特指与公服配用的腰带。
(3)泛指狭长形条状物。可用于捆扎、装饰或传动等。
(4)系束，捆缚。
(5)特指蛇。蛇长如带，故称。亦用以称体形扁长的动物。参见“帶魚”。
(6)地带；区域。
(7)挂，佩带。
(8)谓披戴。
(9)犹戴。
(10)携带，夹带。
(11)率领，带引。
(12)谓抱持抚育。
(13)环绕。
(14)毗连。
(15)映照；笼盖。
(16)兼任。
(17)兼并，领有。
(18)含有，带有。
(19)拽，关上。
(20)量词。
(21)连同。
(22)犹又。表示动作同时进行。
(23)方言。犹多，超过。表示附在整数外较小的数量。
(24)妇女病名。参见“帶下”。
(25)轮胎。
(26)姓。战国有带他。见《史记·陈涉世家》。

帶字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　帶； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页333第06
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?當蓋切，音㯂。【說文】紳也。男子搫帶，婦人帶絲，象繫佩之形。佩必有巾，故帶从巾。【徐鉉曰】卌，其帶上連屬固結處。【釋名】帶，蔕也。著於衣，如物之繫蔕也。【易·訟卦】或錫之鞶帶。【疏】鞶帶大帶也。【禮·玉藻】凡帶有率，無箴功。【疏】謂其帶旣襌，亦以箴緶緝其側，但繂襵之，無別裨飾之箴功。　又【揚子·方言】厲謂之帶。【註】小爾雅，帶之垂者曰厲。【詩·小雅】垂帶而厲。　又佩也。【禮·月令】帶以弓䪅。　又【揚子·方言】行也。【註】隨人行也。　又蟲名。【莊子·齊物論】螂蛆甘帶。　又書帶，草名。【三齊記】鄭康成山下生草，大如䪥，葉長一尺餘，土人名康成書帶草。又姓。【賈誼·過秦論】帶佗。　又叶音蒂。【楚辭·九歌】荷衣兮蕙帶，儵而來兮忽而逝。夕宿兮帝鄉，誰須兮雲之際。

考證：〔【易·訟卦】或錫之鞶帶。【疏】鞶革大帶也。〕　謹照原文革改帶。〔【楚辭·九歌】荷衣分蕙帶，鯈而來兮忽而逝。〕　謹照原文分

band
Basic explanation of words
band
dài
See "band".
band
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dài］
["Guangyun" When the cover is cut, go to Thailand, end. ]
Also known as "帯1". Traditional characters of "带1".
(1) Long, narrow and flat objects used to restrain clothes. In ancient times, it was made of leather, gold jade, rhino horn or silk fabric.
(2) Specifically refers to belts used with public uniforms.
(3) Generally refers to long and narrow strips. It can be used for strapping, decoration or transmission, etc.
(4) Tie and bind.
(5) Especially referring to snakes. The snake is as long as a belt, so it is called. It is also used as a long and flat animal. See "hairtail".
(6) Zone; area.
(7) Hang and wear.
(8) Said to wear.
(9) Still wearing.
(10) Carrying, entrainment.
(11) Lead and lead.
(12) It is called holding and nurturing.
(13) Surround.
(14) Contiguous.
(15) Mirror; cage cover.
(16) Part-time.
(17) Mergers and possessions.
(18) Contains, with.
(19) Pull and close.
(20) Quantifiers.
(21) Together.
(22) Yuyou. Indicates that the actions are performed simultaneously.
(23) Dialects. Judo, more than. Indicates the smaller amount attached to the integer.
(24) Women's disease names. See "Bring Down".
(25) Tires.
(26) Last name. The Warring States period took him. See "Historical Records · Chen She Family".
band

[Yin Collection] [Scarf Character Department] 　带; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 333 No. 06
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? When the cover is cut, the sound is 㯂. [Said Wen] Gentry. The man wears the belt, and the woman wears the silk, like a tie. Wear a towel, so wear a towel. [Xu Xuan said] 卌, his belt is a place of consolidation. [Release name] Belt, pedicle. Wearing on clothing is like the spine of things. 【Easy · Litigation Gua】or Xi's belt. 【Sparse】The belt is also large. 【Rite·Yuzao】Where there is a rate, there is no merit. [Sparse] It is said that it has a sly, and it also uses a scorpion to seize its side, but it is no other advantage to decorate the slogan.　[Yangtze Dialect] Li Weizhi belt. [Note] Xiao Erya, the one who brings it down is called Li. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Be sharp and sharp.　 Pei also. 【Rite·Yueling】Take a bow.　[Yangtze Dialect] It's OK. [Note] You can also walk with you.　 Also known as insects. [Zhuangzi·Qiwu Lun] Manta maggots Gandai.　A book with a cursive name. [Three Qi Ji] Zheng Kangcheng grows grass under the mountain, which is as big as a li, and the leaves are more than one foot long. The native name Kang Cheng has grass. Another surname. 【Jia Yi·Guo Qin Theory】Take Tuo.　Ye Yindi again. [Songs of the Chu·Nine Songs] The lotus clothes come and go and die suddenly. Xisu Xidixiang, who must be the occasion of the cloud.
